Class FileIO 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----FileIO
public class FileIO
extends Object

numlines

FileIO(String, int)
Constructor.

eof()
End Of File.
peekChar()
Returns the next character without actually reading it.
readChar()
Reads the next character from the file.
readEverything()
Reads everything in the file in.
readln()
Read a line from the file and return it.
reset()
Reads from the beginning of the file.
write(String)
Writes a string to a file.
writeln(String)
Writes a string to a file.

numlines 
 public int numlines

FileIO 
 public FileIO(String newFileName,
               int mode)
Constructor. Note that a FileIO object only does input or output on a file, not both.

Parameters:
newFileName - The name of the file you want to operate on.
mode - The mode of operations, 0 = input, 1 = output

eof 
 public boolean eof()
End Of File. Have we read in all the lines we can.

Returns:
true, cannot read in any more; false, otherwise
readln 
 public String readln()
Read a line from the file and return it.

Returns:
the next line of text
readChar 
 public char readChar()
Reads the next character from the file.

Returns:
The next character.
peekChar 
 public char peekChar()
Returns the next character without actually reading it.

Returns:
the next character
readEverything 
 public void readEverything()
Reads everything in the file in. Used by constructor.

writeln 
 public void writeln(String s)
Writes a string to a file. Note that this method appends a carriage return-line feed, you do not need to add \n to the end of the string you want written.

Parameters:
s - the string you want written.
write 
 public void write(String s)
Writes a string to a file.

Parameters:
s - the string you want written.
reset 
 public void reset()
Reads from the beginning of the file.
